definition: to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: Get expert professional assistance if violence erupts.
sentences.chinese: 当不傲立突发时寻求专家援助。

sentences.english: Despite the hard winter, the rose is still alive.
sentences.chinese: 尽管冬天严寒，玫瑰丛仍然傲立风霜。

sentences.english: Still, it is commonly in the blend of pine trees.
sentences.chinese: 静，是松树一般傲立于世的品格。

definition: to tower/to stand straight (of person's bearing)
to stand for a long time
to tower/standing tall and upright (of large building)
to stand tall and rock-solid (idiom)/towering majestically/(of a person) to stand up against sb
to look disdainfully out of the corner of one's eye
to turn up one's nose/to show disdain for/to regard superciliously
head high/in high spirits/to raise one's head (e.g. of neighing horse)
